tool.name: ApplyReducerbyID
tool.displayname: Apply Reducers to Earth Engine Dataset by Asset ID

param.name: data_type
param.displayname: Choose the dataset type to be reduced
param.dialogReference: Select the type of the Earth Engine dataset among feature collection, image and image collection. Different datasets have different reduction methods.

param.name: reduction_args
param.displayname: Specify the arguments of the reduction method
param.dialogReference: Specify any additional arguments in the reduction method. For example, ee.Image.reduceRegion may have geometry=geom, scale=30, crs='EPSG:3310' in addition to the core argument reducer=reducer

param.name: asset_id
param.displayname: Specify the asset ID of the dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the asset ID of the dataset

param.name: reducer_list
param.dialogReference: Select reducers to be applied. Multiple reducers will be combined.

param.name: shared_inputs
param.displayname: Use the same inputs for all reducers
param.dialogReference: Check this box if sharedInput is True for combined reducer.

param.name: out_json
param.displayname: Specify the output JSON file to save the serialized object
param.dialogReference: Save the reduced dataset as a serialized JSON object for future use. When you use this JSON file again, the dataset already has the reducers applied.

tool.summary:
This script applies reducers to feature collection, image or image collection by asset ID, and saves the reduced dataset to serialized JSON object for future use.

To browser all available earth engine filters, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/apidocs/ee-reducer-allnonzero.

For reducer overview, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/guides/reducers_intro.

idCitation.resTitle: Apply Reducers to Earth Engine Dataset by Asset ID
